selfish.translation[0].definitions[0].de: caring only about yourself and not about other people – used to show disapproval
selfish.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: How can you be so selfish?
selfish.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: selfish
thinking only about what you need or want, and not thinking about how other people feel or what other people want – used especially when criticizing a person or their behaviour
Amy, don’t be selfish. Let the others have a turn.
'I’m not doing this for selfish reasons, ' he said.
It was a very selfish thing to do.
egocentric
believing that what you do and think is the most important thing, and not paying attention to what anyone else thinks or does – used when describing someone’s personality
Teenagers can be highly egocentric, and sometimes find it difficult to see another person’s point of view.
Children start off as self-centred little beings and they do not naturally think of the other person.
egotistical
believing that you are better or more important than other people
Like many famous writers I’ve met, he was arrogant and egotistical.
He’s just another young player who has gone out of control in the increasingly egotistical world of professional sports.
self-serving
only thinking of getting advantages for yourself
People’s fears are exaggerated by self-serving politicians.
They described the report as ‘self-serving and contradictory’.
think of nobody but yourself
to only think of what you want to do, and not consider what other people want – often used when criticizing someone who does this
The trouble with Alan is that he thinks of nobody but himself.
Before I had children, I only thought about myself and what I wanted.
it’s always me me me!
used when criticizing someone for being selfish
It’s always me, me, me with you and I have had enough. I don’t need this – you’re welcome to yourself, my dear.
